uk.ac.aber.dcs.odj.concordance
Class CustomNode

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.aber.dcs.odj.concordance.CustomNode
Direct Known Subclasses:
StringHolder, WordEntry
public abstract class CustomNode
extends java.lang.Object

Interface to build 'Custom Node' elements for Linked Lists and other ADTs. Based on the idea that you might want to avoid the encapsulation that Java's own Node implementations have - instead of having a parameter (e.g. 'data') that's a reference to an underlying Object, you have multiple parameters in which to store your data, eliminating the need for extra reference variables/ instantiated objects.

Author:
Owain Jones

Method Detail

next

public CustomNode next()
next() without any arguments gets the next CustomNode in the chain, or returns null if there isn't one (e.g. we're at the end of the list).

Returns:
the next CustomNode in the chain.

next

public void next(CustomNode node)
next() with a CustomNode argument sets the next CustomNode in the chain to the 'node' parameter

Parameters:
node - CustomNode to set

identical

public boolean identical(CustomNode node)
Do a deep equality comparison to check whether two objects are the same. Used in LittleLinkedList to stop us adding the same thing twice. Children of this class have to implement this method to actually do any checking.

Parameters:
node - The CustomNode offspring to compare against
Returns:
false by default
